title: Under Pressure, Wal-Mart Urges Suppliers To Cut Costs
teaser: As the retail giant loses market share to rivals like Costco and Kroger, it's putting pressure on suppliers to bring down costs.
contentencoded:
Wal-Mart is putting pressure on its suppliers to bring down costs. The move comes as Wal-Mart has been losing market share to rivals like Costco and Kroger, according to data from the consulting group Kantar Retail. Here & Now’s Robin Young speaks with Ali Velshi, host of “Real Money” on Al Jazeera America, about the pressures facing Wal-Mart.

Guest

  • Ali Velshi, host of Real Money on Al Jazeera America. He tweets @AliVelshi.
